FuncDef:
The ttl-mode command to is used to configure the TTL processing mode for the SRv6 TE policy.
The undo ttl-mode command is used to restore the default configuration.
By default, enable SRv6 TE Policy to process the TTL in pipe mode.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the processing mode of the TTL for the SRv6 TE Policy to be uniform.
-

Specifies the processing mode of the TTL for the SRv6 TE Policy to be pipe.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In the scenario of the public network IP iteration SRv6 TE Policy, the SRv6 TE Policy has two modes for processing TTL:
Uniform mode: At the ingress node, the TTL value of the inner packet is decremented by 1 and then mapped to the IPv6 TTL field. Thereafter, the packet is processed in the IPv6 network according to the standard TTL processing. At the egress node, the IPv6 TTL is decremented by 1 and then mapped to the TTL field of the inner packet.Pipe mode: The inner message is decremented by only 1 at the ingress and egress, and the entire SRv6 TE Policy is treated as 1 hop.
